meanings.definition: A statement or assertion that expresses a judgment or opinion.
meanings.sent1: The teacher made a proposition about the best book to read.
meanings.sent2: I disagree with your proposition that cats are better than dogs.
meanings.sent3: His proposition that ice cream is a vegetable was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her proposition that time is a rubber band stretched everyone's imagination.
meanings.sent5: The proposition that laughter is contagious is widely accepted.

meanings.definition: A plan or scheme proposed for consideration.
meanings.sent1: The company presented a proposition for a new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent2: Let's discuss the proposition to renovate the office space.
meanings.sent3: The proposition to replace all chairs with bean bags raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His proposition to turn the office into a jungle sparked creativity.
meanings.sent5: The proposition to have a weekly pizza party was a hit with the team.

meanings.definition: The act of proposing or suggesting something.
meanings.sent1: Her proposition of a team outing was well-received.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your proposition to improve our workflow.
meanings.sent3: His proposition to have a nap time at work was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: The proposition of a dress code change caused a stir in the office.
meanings.sent5: The proposition of a potluck lunch brought smiles to everyone's faces.
